yaml.title: karl vilgot hubertus vilhelmsson emneby :-)
yaml.subtitle: chai, bair & berkeley physics. ex slac

markdown.markdown: I've spent the past decade on learning the foundation of the physical world. I'll spend the next on figuring out what thinking is for the purpose of inventing safer and better models. - Starting early Sept. 2025, I'm an interpretability researcher at CHAI (Center for Human-Compatible AI)/BAIR (Berkeley AI Research lab) with [Cam Allen](https://camallen.net/). I'm submitting an ICLR workshop paper on world models tonight (written Feb 2). - I'm also a 4th-year physics major at Berkeley. - Until late Aug. 2025, I was a particle physics researcher at the Neutrino Group at SLAC National Accelerator Laboratory under Professor Hirohisa Tanaka. [I used latent spaces to investigate the low-energy excess of electron neutrinos](https://github.com/karlcal1/MiniBooNE-studies/blob/main/presentation.pdf) detected in the MiniBooNE experiment. - Before SLAC, I worked on Bayesian analysis for Mu2e under Professor Yury Kolomensky. - Before Berkeley, I wanted to experience "real life" -- so I went all in and took a half a year to work as a trash man. Then I went to South America for a half a year. Things like the deadly fear I felt when running from [wild dogs in the desert](desert_around_arequipa.jpg) gave me clarity on [what matters in life](friends_n_fam.jpg). - I love language and spend more than half of my time speaking languages other than English (~ 30% Chinese, 30% English, 15% Spanish, 15% Swedish/Norwegian, 10% Italian) - Apart from family and friends, my values have been influenced greatly by Marcus Aurelius's *Meditations*, Confucius's *Lunyu* ( *论语* ), Noah Harari's *Homo sapiens*, and, honestly, Avatar the Last Airbender and SpongeBob. The most transformative read of my life was when I read Joanne Baker's *50 Physics Ideas You Really Need to Know* as a kid. I love chatting about the geometry of thinking and other AI topics [over a boba](iroh.png)! Feel free to reach out at the correct reordering of this set of strings: "berkeley", "@", ".", "edu", "karlcal"
